meanings.definition: A sleeveless garment worn by Jewish priests.
meanings.sent1: The priest put on his ephod before the ceremony.
meanings.sent2: The ephod was an important part of the priest's attire.
meanings.sent3: The ephod looked like a special shirt without sleeves.
meanings.sent4: The ephod symbolized the priest's role in the temple.
meanings.sent5: The ephod was carefully crafted with intricate designs.

meanings.definition: A sacred vestment worn by the high priest in ancient Israel.
meanings.sent1: The high priest wore the ephod during important rituals.
meanings.sent2: The ephod was a symbol of the high priest's authority.
meanings.sent3: The ephod was so sacred that only the high priest could wear it.
meanings.sent4: The ephod shimmered in the candlelight of the temple.
meanings.sent5: The ephod was believed to bring blessings to the wearer.

meanings.definition: A garment worn for religious purposes.
meanings.sent1: The ephod was worn during religious ceremonies.
meanings.sent2: The colorful ephod added a touch of reverence to the attire.
meanings.sent3: The ephod was considered a holy piece of clothing.
meanings.sent4: The ephod was a symbol of devotion and faith.
meanings.sent5: The ephod was passed down through generations as a sacred relic.
